tournament.name: MagicFest Online Season 2 - Weekly Championship - Week 1

decks.notes: The key idea of this deck revolves around an aggressive playstyle with a focus on maximizing damage output. It utilizes cards like Obosh, the Preypiercer, Judith, the Scourge Diva, and Mayhem Devil to amplify damage from creatures and abilities. The deck also includes a sacrifice theme, making use of Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, and Witch's Oven to generate value and further punish opponents. Additionally, the inclusion of Heraldic Banner provides mana acceleration and allows for more explosive plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and strategic sacrifices to achieve victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By utilizing cards like Mystical Dispute, Expansion / Explosion, and Wilderness Reclamation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage for itself. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card draw and life gain, while Shark Typhoon creates evasive threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with a mix of shock lands, triomes, and utility lands like Castle Vantress and Blast Zone.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements and card advantage to outvalue opponents. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy while digging for answers with Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Omen of the Sea. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Aether Gust until it can land powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery to close out the game. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value and versatility in longer games.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cycling cards and cards that benefit from cycling to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle. By cycling through the deck, the player can trigger effects such as creating tokens, dealing damage, and drawing cards, ultimately building towards a powerful finisher like Zenith Flare. The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to generate value and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Fires of Invention to play powerful spells and creatures without having to worry about mana costs. It utilizes control elements like Teferi and Narset to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. The deck also includes strong finishers like Shark Typhoon, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith to close out the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around managing resources efficiently and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of big threats and disruptive elements.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Fires of Invention enchantment to play multiple high-cost cards for free each turn, allowing the player to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck includes a mix of creatures with haste and trample, as well as card draw engines like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate and Bonders' Enclave to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion enhances the deck's synergy and adds another powerful creature to the mix.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing spells and card draw to maintain board advantage. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Fabled Passage, eventually playing powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck also features a suite of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By generating an advantage through card draw, mana ramp, and control elements, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the pace of the game through interaction and tempo plays, utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate advantage. By managing the board with removal spells and countermagic, while ramping and drawing cards efficiently, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually finish them off with powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion or Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The key strategy is to maintain control of the game until the late game where the deck can overwhelm the opponent with its resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and counter spells, while generating card advantage and ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The main win condition is using Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to out-value the opponent, with Yorion, Sky Nomad providing additional value by blinking permanents for extra value. The deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, and ramp cards like Growth Spiral. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate advantage, the deck can outvalue opponents with threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in the late game. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

This Bant Control deck focuses on using powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a variety of ramp cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to accelerate mana production and play big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Cavalier of Thorns. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and efficient removal spells, while ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Yorion, Sky Nomad.

Using Fires of Invention to cast powerful control spells and creatures to dominate the opponent and maintain board control, while utilizing the high mana curve to benefit from Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion for card advantage. This deck aims to slow down the game, control the board, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats once the Fires of Invention is in play. The combination of control elements and high-powered creatures makes this deck a challenging opponent to face in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this deck is to focus on controlling the board through powerful spells and creatures, while also taking advantage of the Fires of Invention card to cast spells for free. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and high-impact creatures such as Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame. The companion, Keruga, the Macrosage, provides additional card advantage, allowing the player to maintain a strong hand while controlling the game. Overall, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan and steadily build up resources for a game-winning finish.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. It utilizes cards like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage with Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, allowing it to drop threats like Hydroid Krasis and Casualties of War to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value by blinking key permanents for extra advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw in order to stall the game until you can establish a strong board presence. The win condition of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana with Wilderness Reclamation and then use that mana to either cast a massive Shark Typhoon or finish off your opponent with Expansion / Explosion. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and life gain to help you survive in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, counterspells, and board control. It utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana advantage and Shark Typhoon to create threats and blockers. The deck includes a mix of card draw spells, counterspells, and versatile threats like Uro, Brazen Borrower, and Nightpack Ambusher. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent while maintaining control of the game through a combination of efficient removal, countermagic, and card advantage.
